com.samysadi.acs.hardware.network.operation

Class NetworkOperationDefault

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samysadi.acs.core.notifications.NotifierImpl
      • com.samysadi.acs.core.tracing.ProbedImpl
        • com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.EntityImpl
          • com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.RunnableEntityImpl
            • com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation.OperationImpl<Resource>
              • com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation.LongOperationImpl<NetworkResource>
                • com.samysadi.acs.hardware.network.operation.NetworkOperationDefault
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Entity, RunnableEntity, Notifier, Probed, NetworkOperation, Operation<NetworkResource>, RemoteOperation<NetworkResource>, SynchronizableOperation<NetworkResource>, Cloneable

    public class NetworkOperationDefault
extends LongOperationImpl<NetworkResource>
implements NetworkOperation, SynchronizableOperation<NetworkResource>
    This implementation will automatically find a new Route using the RoutingProtocol on the host of the parent job's VM each time it is activated.

    Make sure that the RoutingProtocol on the host of the parent job's VM is not null or a NullPointerException will be thrown whenever you try to start this operation.

    Since:
    1.0

      • NetworkOperationDefault

        public NetworkOperationDefault()
        Empty constructor that creates a zero-length operation with a null destination job.

        This constructor is provided only to satisfy the Entity contract.
        You should use NetworkOperationDefault(Job, long) though.

      • isRetransmitOnError

        public boolean isRetransmitOnError()
        Description copied from interface: NetworkOperation
        Returns true if data should be retransmitted on error.

        If false that means that the loss rate between nodes is not taken into account, which may be used to simulate communications where data integrity doesn't matter a lot.

        Specified by:
        isRetransmitOnError in interface NetworkOperation
        Returns:
        true if data should be retransmitted on error

      • setDestinationJob

        public void setDestinationJob(Job destinationJob)
        Description copied from interface: RemoteOperation
        Sets the new destinationJob.

        A NotificationCodes.OPERATION_DEST_JOB_CHANGED is thrown.
        The old destinationJob is notified using NotificationCodes.JOB_DEST_OPERATION_REMOVED.
        The new destinationJob is notified using NotificationCodes.JOB_DEST_OPERATION_ADDED.

        Specified by:
        setDestinationJob in interface RemoteOperation<NetworkResource>
        Parameters:
        destinationJob - the new destinationJob

      • canRestart

        public boolean canRestart()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Returns true if this entity can be restarted safely, and calling RunnableEntity.doRestart() on this entity will not throw an exception.

        Usually, this methods returns true, if these next conditions are verified:

        • RunnableEntity.isRunning() returns false;
        • Calling Entity.hasParentRec() on this entity returns true;
        • If the parent of this entity is a RunnableEntity, then it must be running;
        • Other implementation-specific conditions may also apply.
        Specified by:
        canRestart in interface RunnableEntity
        Overrides:
        canRestart in class RunnableEntityImpl
        Returns:
        true if this entity can be restarted safely

      • canStart

        public boolean canStart()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Returns true if this entity can be started safely, and calling RunnableEntity.doStart() on this entity will not throw an exception.

        This methods returns true, if these next conditions are verified:

        • RunnableEntity.isTerminated() returns false;
        • RunnableEntity.isRunning() returns false;
        • Calling Entity.hasParentRec() on this entity returns true;
        • If the parent of this entity is a RunnableEntity, then it must be running;
        • Other implementation-specific conditions may also apply.
        Specified by:
        canStart in interface RunnableEntity
        Overrides:
        canStart in class RunnableEntityImpl
        Returns:
        true if this entity can be started safely

      • startSynchronization

        public void startSynchronization(long delay,
                        Operation<?> operation)
        Description copied from interface: SynchronizableOperation
        Call this method so that the current operation will adjust its allocated resource in order to finish (ie: to be completed) after running for at least the given delay.

        Calling this method will guarantee that this operation needs to be running for at least the given delay before it becomes completed.
        But this method does not guarantee that the operation will be completed after it has been running for exactly the given delay, in the case where it gets a too low resource promise from its provisioner. It may still need extra running time to be completed.

        If synchronization was already started using this method, then this method should behave as if it was called after calling SynchronizableOperation.stopSynchronization().

        Specified by:
        startSynchronization in interface SynchronizableOperation<NetworkResource>
        Parameters:
        delay - minimum remaining delay for this operation
        operation - contains the operation which the current operation is synchronized with, if any

      • stopSynchronization

        public void stopSynchronization()
        Description copied from interface: SynchronizableOperation
        Call this method to clear any synchronization restrictions that were set using SynchronizableOperation.startSynchronization(long, Operation).

        If the operation is not synchronized, then nothing is done.

        Specified by:
        stopSynchronization in interface SynchronizableOperation<NetworkResource>

      • isSynchronized

        public boolean isSynchronized(Operation<?> operation)
        Description copied from interface: SynchronizableOperation
        Return true if current operation is synchronized with the given operation.

        In other words, this method returns true if this operation is synchronized using SynchronizableOperation.startSynchronization(long, Operation), AND the operation which it is synchronized with is the same as the given operation. false is returned if the given operation was not synchronized at all, or if SynchronizableOperation.stopSynchronization() was used.

        Specified by:
        isSynchronized in interface SynchronizableOperation<NetworkResource>
        Returns:
        true if current operation is synchronized with the given operation

      • notify

        public void notify(int notification_code,
          Object data)
        Description copied from interface: Notifier
        For each listener that was added using the given notification_code, this method does one of the following actions.

        If calling NotificationListener.isInstantNotification() returns true then the listener's code is executed immediately.

        If calling NotificationListener.isInstantNotification() returns false then this method schedules an event in order to execute the listener's code.

        Regarding the last case, there should be an individual event for each listener, and each of them is scheduled at the current simulator's time.
        Also, this method will not schedule another event for a listener if it already has another scheduled and not yet processed event with the same notification_code and data.

        The calling order of the listeners is undetermined. Thus a new listener may be called before an older listener and vice versa.

        Use Notifier.notifyNow(int, Object) to notify listeners immediately.

        Specified by:
        notify in interface Notifier
        Overrides:
        notify in class NotifierImpl
        data - extra data supplied for the listener when its code is executed
